78925 THE INSTITUTES OF TECHNOLOGY ACT, 1961
ACT NO. 59 OF 1961 [ 19th December, 1961.]
An Act to declare certain institutions of technology to be institutions of national importance and to provide for certain matters connected with such institutions and the Indian Institute of Technology, Kharagpur.
BE it enacted by Parliament in the Twelfth Year of the Republic of India as follows:-
CHAP
PRELIMINARY
CHAPTER I
PRELIMINARY

361303 1This Act may be called the Institutes of Technology Act, 1961.
1287681 2It shall come into force on such date 1 as the Central Government may, by notification in the Official Gazette, appoint, and different dates may be appointed for different provisions of this Act.
684814 2Declaration of certain institutions as institutions of national importance. Whereas the objects of the institutions known as the Indian Institute of Technology, Bombay, 2 the College of Engineering and Technology, Delhi, 3 The Indian Institute of technogys Guwahati, Assam] the Indian Institute of Technology, Kanpur and the Indian Institute of Technology, Madras are such as to make them institutions of national importance, it is hereby declared that each such institution is an institution of national importance.

THE INSTITUTES
CHAPTER II
THE INSTITUTES
1585254 4 Incorporation of institutes.
27249 1Each of the Institutes mentioned in section 2 shall be a body corporate having perpetual succession and a common seal and shall, by its name, sue and be sued.
1206480 1A1 The College of Engineering and Technology, Delhi shall, on such incorporation, be called the Indian Institute of Technology, Delhi.]
1210206 1B2 The Indian Institute of Technology, Guwahati, Assam shall, on such incorporation, be called the Indian Institute of Technology, Guwahati."]
1068450 2The body corporate constituting each of the said Institutes shall consist of a Chairman, a Director and other members of the Board for the time being of the Institute. 151 1Ins. by Act 29 of 1963, s. 4 (w. e. f. 13- 9- 1963). 2. Ins by Act 35 of 1994, s. 4 (w. e. f. 1- 9- 1994).
950871 5 Effect of incorporation of institutes. On and from the commencement of this Act,--
1977420 aany reference to a society in any law (other than this Act) or in any contract or other instrument shall be deemed as a reference to the corresponding Institute;
305587 ball property, movable and immovable, of or belonging to a society shall vest in the corresponding Institute;
1240776 call the rights and liabilities of a society shall be transferred to, and be the rights and liabilities of, the corresponding Institute; and
194200 devery person employed by a society immediately before such commencement shall hold his office or service in the corresponding Institute by the same tenure, at the same remuneration and upon the same terms and conditions and with the same rights and privileges as to pension, leave, gratuity, provident fund and other matters as he would have held the same if this Act had not been passed, and shall continue to do so unless and until his employment is terminated or until such tenure, remuneration and terms and conditions are duly altered by the Statutes: Provided that if the alteration so made is not acceptable to such employee, his employment may be terminated by the Institute in accordance with the terms of the contract with the employee or, if no provision is made therein in this behalf, on payment to him by the Institute of compensation equivalent to three months' remuneration in the case of permanent employees and one month' s remuneration in the case of other employees.
1 Explanation.-- The reference in this section to the ccommence- ment of this Act shall be construed in relation to the Indian Institute of Technology, Guwahati as the reference to the date on which the provisions of the Institutes of Technology (Amendment) Act, 1994 come into force."]
191382 6 Powers of Institutes.
1768678 1Subject to the provisions of this Act, every Institute shall exercise the following powers and perform the following duties, namely:-
186207 ato provide for instruction and research in such branches of engineering and technology, sciences and arts, as the Institute may think fit, and for the advancement of learning and dissemination of knowledge in such branches;
771749 bto hold examinations and grant degrees, diplomas and other academic distinctions or titles;
151089 cto confer honorary degrees or other distinctions; 1
1087446 1 Ins. by Act 35 of 1994, s. 5 (w. e. f. 1- 9- 1994).
152
1721370 dto fix, demand and receive fees and other charges;
251135 eto establish, maintain and manage halls and hostels for the residence of students;
602848 fto supervise and control the residence and regulate the discipline of students of the Institute and to make arrangements for promoting their health, general welfare and cultural and corporate life;
1184870 gto provide for the maintenance of units of the National Cadet Corps for the students of the Institute;
566290 hto institute academic and other posts and to make appointments thereto (except in the case of the Director);
237754 ito frame Statutes and Ordinances and to alter, modify or rescind the same;
1079835 jto deal with any property belonging to or vested in the Institute in such manner as the Institute may deem fit for advancing the objects of the Institute;
1235202 kto receive gifts, grants, donations or benefactions from the Government and to receive bequests, donations and transfers of movable or immovable properties from testators, donors or transferors, as the case may be;
813055 lto co- operate with educational or other institutions in any part of the world having objects wholly or partly similar to those of the Institute by exchange of teachers and scholars and generally in such manner as may be conducive to their common objects;
1845400 mto institute and award fellowships, scholarships, exhibitions, prizes and medals; and
679358 nto do all such things as may be necessary, incidental or conducive to the attainment of all or any of the objects of the Institute.
789157 2Notwithstanding anything contained in sub- section (1), an Institute shall not dispose of in any manner any immovable property without the prior approval of the Visitor.
314217 7 Institutes to be open to all races, creeds and classes.
778106 1 Every Institute shall be open to persons of either sex and of whatever race, creed, caste or class, and no test or condition shall be imposed as to religious belief or profession in admitting or appointing members, students, teachers or workers or in any other connection whatsoever.
153
721769 2No bequest, donation or transfer of any property shall be accepted by any Institute which in the opinion of the Council involves conditions or obligations opposed to the spirit and object of this section.
1388525 8Teaching at Institute. All teaching at each of the Institutes shall be conducted by or in the name of the Institute in accordance with the Statutes and Ordinances made in this behalf.
1104256 9 Visitor.
1051427 1The President of India shall be the Visitor of every Institute.
471818 2The Visitor may appoint one or more persons to review the work and progress of any Institute and to hold inquiries into the affairs thereof and to report thereon in such manner as the Visitor may direct.
1996522 3Upon receipt of any such report, the Visitor may take such action and issue such directions as he considers necessary in respect of any of the matters dealt with in the report and the Institute shall be bound to comply with such directions.
576365 10 Authorities of Institutes. The following shall be the authorities of an Institute, namely:-
548048 aa Board of Governors;
1500227 ba Senate; and
1447549 csuch other authorities as may be declared by the Statutes to be the authorities of the Institute.
1073145 11 Board of Governors. The Board of an Institute shall consist of the following persons, namely:-
999690 athe Chairman, to be nominated by the Visitor;
252175 bthe Director, ex officio;
743977 cone person to be nominated by the Government of each of the States comprising the zone in which the Institute is situated, from among persons who, in the opinion of that Government, are technologists or industrialists of repute;
1500003 dfour persons having special knowledge or practical experience in respect of education, engineering or science, to be nominated by the Council; and
154
489793 etwo professors of the Institute, to be nominated by the Senate. Explanation.-- In this section, the expression" zone" means a zone as for the time being demarcated by the All- India Council for Technical Education for the purposes of this Act.
1585216 12 Term of office of, vacancies among, and allowances payable to, members of Board.
1995890 1Save as otherwise provided in this section, the term of office of the Chairman or any other member of the Board shall be three years from the date of his nomination.
56091 2The term of office of an ex officio member shall continue so long as he holds the office by virtue of which he is a member.
23574 3The term of office of a member nominated under 1 clause (e)] of section 11 shall be two years from the 1st day of January of the year in which he is nominated.
125968 4The term of office of a member nominated to fill a casual vacancy shall continue for the remainder of the term of the member in whose place he has been nominated.
62022 5Notwithstanding anything contained in this section, an outgoing member shall, unless the Council otherwise directs, continue in office until another person is nominated as a member in his place.
240919 6The members of the Board shall be entitled to such allowances, if any, from the Institute as may be provided for in the Statutes but no member other than the persons referred to in clauses (b) and (e) of section 11 shall be entitled to any salary by reason of this sub- section.
974355 13 Functions of Board.
736870 1Subject to the provisions of this Act, the Board of any Institute shall be responsible for the general superintendence, direction and control of the affairs of the Institute and shall exercise all the powers of the Institute not otherwise provided for by this Act, the Statutes and the Ordinances, and shall have the power to review the acts of the Senate.
1510481 2Without prejudice to the provisions of sub- section (1), the Board of any Institute shall-
1678312 atake decisions on questions of policy relating to the administration and working of the Institute;
4374 binstitute courses of study at the Institute;
352619 cmake Statutes; 155 1Subs. by Act 29 of 1963, s. 5, for" clause (c)" (retrospectively).
314413 dinstitute and appoint persons to academic as well as other posts in the Institute;
450295 econsider and modify or cancel Ordinances;
1569194 fconsider and pass resolutions on the annual report, the annual accounts and the budget estimates of the Institute for the next financial year as it thinks fit and submit them to the Council together with a statement of its development plans;
566016 gexercise such other powers and perform such other duties as may be conferred or imposed upon it by this Act or the Statutes.
760457 3The Board shall have the power to appoint such committees as it considers necessary for the exercise of its powers and the performance of its duties under this Act.
1808686 14 Senate. The Senate of each Institute shall consist of the following persons, namely:-
807947 athe Director, ex officio, who shall be the Chairman of the Senate;
1922752 bthe Deputy Director, ex officio;
486083 cthe professors appointed or recognised as such by the Institute for the purpose of imparting instruction in the Institute;
1520439 dthree persons, not being employees of the Institute, to be nominated by the Chairman in consultation with the Director, from among educationists of repute, one each from the fields of science, engineering and humanities; and
1661657 esuch other members of the staff as may be laid down in the Statutes.
1287851 15Functions of Senate. Subject to the provisions of this Act, the Statutes and the Ordinances, the Senate of an Institute shall have the control and general regulation, and be responsible for the maintenance, of standards of instruction, education and examination in the Institute and shall exercise such other powers and perform such other duties as may be conferred or imposed upon it by the Statutes.
1497516 16 Chairman of Board.
1242714 1The Chairman shall ordinarily preside at the meetings of the Board and at the Convocations of the Institute.
156
798775 2It shall be the duty of the Chairman to ensure that the decisions taken by the Board are implemented.
1800564 3The Chairman shall exercise such other powers and perform such other duties as may be assigned to him by this Act or the Statutes.
1975046 17 Director.
450897 1The Director of each Institute shall be appointed by the Council with the prior approval of the Visitor.
937484 2The Director shall be the principal academic and executive officer of the Institute and shall be responsible for the proper administration of the Institute and for the imparting of instruction and maintenance of discipline therein.
122907 3The Director shall submit annual reports and accounts to the Board.
989723 4The Director shall exercise such other powers and perform such other duties as may be assigned to him by this Act or the Statutes or Ordinances.
54171 18Deputy Director. The Deputy Director of each Institute shall be appointed on such terms and conditions as may be laid down by the Statutes and shall exercise such powers and perform such duties as may be assigned to him by this Act or the Statutes or by the Director.
611039 19 Registrar.
878580 1The Registrar of each Institute shall be appointed on such terms and conditions as may be laid down by the Statutes and shall be the custodian of records, the common seal, the funds of the Institute and such other property of the Institute as the Board shall commit to his charge.
1889447 2The Registrar shall act as the Secretary of the Board, the Senate, and such committees as may be prescribed by the Statutes.
1428727 3The Registrar shall be responsible to the Director for the proper discharge of his functions.
929750 4The Registrar shall exercise such other powers and perform such other duties as may be assigned to him by this Act or the Statutes or by the Director.
405486 20Other authorities and officers. The powers and duties of authorities and officers other than those hereinbefore mentioned shall be determined by the Statutes.
157
1030781 21Grants by Central Government. For the purpose of enabling the Institutes to discharge their functions efficiently under this Act, the Central Government may, after due appropriation made by Parliament by law in this behalf, pay to each Institute in each financial year such sums of money and in such manner as it may think fit.
1536192 22 Fund of the Institute.
41129 1Every Institute shall maintain a Fund to which shall be credited-
226401 aall moneys provided by the Central Government;
223840 ball fees and other charges received by the Institute;
1259946 call moneys received by the Institute by way of grants, gifts, donations, benefactions, bequests or transfers; and
979725 dall moneys received by the Institute in any other manner or from any other source.
1707679 2All moneys credited to the Fund of any Institute shall be deposited in such Banks or invested in such manner as the Institute may, with the approval of the Central Government, decide.
513137 3The Fund of any Institute shall be applied towards meeting the expenses of the Institute including expenses incurred in the exercise of its powers and discharge of its duties under this Act.
208958 23 Accounts and audit.
359162 1Every Institute shall maintain proper accounts and other relevant records and prepare an annual statement of accounts, including the balance- sheet, in such form as may be prescribed by the Central Government in consultation with the Comptroller and Auditor- General of India.
816651 2The accounts of every Institute shall be audited by the Comptroller and Auditor- General of India and any expenditure incurred by him in connection with such audit shall be payable by the Institute to the Comptroller and Auditor- General of India.
954047 3The Comptroller and Auditor- General of India and any person appointed by him in connection with the audit of the accounts of any Institute shall have the same rights, privileges and authority in connection with such audit as the comptroller and Auditor- General of India has in connection with the audit of the Government accounts, and, in particular, shall have the right to demand the production of books, accounts, connected vouchers and other documents and papers and to inspect the offices of the Institute.
115236 4The accounts of every Institute as certified by the comptroller and Auditor- General of India or any other person appointed by
158
him in this behalf together with the audit report thereon shall be forwarded annually to the Central Government and that Government shall cause the same to be laid before each House of Parliament.
1720499 24 Pension and provident fund.
1610476 1Every Institute shall constitute for the benefit of its employees, including the Director, in such manner and subject to such conditions as may be prescribed by the Statutes, such pension, insurance and provident funds as it may deem fit.
530074 2Where any such provident fund has been so constituted, the Central Government may declare that the provisions of the Provident funds Act, 1925 (19 of 1925) shall apply to such fund as if it were a Government Provident Fund.
1486102 25 Appointments. All appointments on the staff of any Institute, except that of the Director, shall be made in accordance with the procedure laid down in the Statutes, by-
973104 athe Board, if the appointment is made on the academic staff in the post of Lecturer or above or if the appointment is made on the non- academic staff in any cadre the maximum of the pay- scale for which exceeds six hundred rupees per month;
1988908 bby the Director, in any other case.
696289 26 Statutes. Subject to the provisions of this Act, the Statutes may provide for all or any of the following matters, namely:-
1217416 athe conferment of honorary degrees;
141291 bthe formation of departments of teaching;
1475835 cthe fees to be charged for courses of study in the Institute and for admission to the examinations of degree and diplomas of the Institute;
1031898 dthe institution of fellowships, scholarships, exhibitions, medals and prizes;
1414132 ethe term of office and the method of appointment of officers of the Institute;
1703461 fthe qualifications of teachers of the Institute;
611582 gthe classification, the method of appointment and the determination of the terms and conditions of service of, teachers and other staff of the Institute;
159
136120 hthe constitution of pension, insurance and provident funds for the benefit of the officers, teachers and other staff of the Institute;
1590207 ithe constitution, powers and duties of the authorities of the Institute;
1351349 jthe establishment and maintenance of halls and hostels;
1028533 kthe conditions of residence of students of the Institute and the levying of fees for residence in the halls and hostels and of other charges;
1381008 lthe manner of filling vacancies among members of the Board;
1436081 mthe allowances to be paid to the Chairman and members of the Board;
1408250 nthe authentication of the orders and decisions of the Board;
959643 othe meetings of the Board, the Senate, or any Committee, the quorum at such meetings and the procedure to be followed in the conduct of their business;
436410 pany other matter which by this Act is to be or may be prescribed by the Statutes.
429955 27 Statutes how made.
80415 1The first Statutes of each Institute shall be framed by the Council with the previous approval of the Visitor and a copy of the same shall be laid as soon as may be before each House of Parliament.
782491 2The Board may, from time to time, make new or additional Statutes or may amend or repeal the Statutes in the manner hereafter in this section provided.
1877994 3Every new Statute or addition to the Statutes or any amendment or repeal of a Statute shall require the previous approval of the Visitor who may assent thereto or withhold assent or remit it to the Board for consideration.
1590392 4A new Statute or a Statute amending or repealing an existing Statute shall have no validity unless it has been assented to by the Visitor.
13407 28 Ordinances. Subject to the provisions of this Act and the Statutes, the Ordinances of each Institute may provide for all or any of the following matters, namely:-
1589243 athe admission of the students to the Institute;
160
1793976 bthe courses of study to be laid down for all degrees and diplomas of the Institute;
1277805 cthe conditions under which students shall be admitted to the degree or diploma courses and to the examinations of the Institute, and shall be eligible for degrees and diplomas;
1011574 dthe conditions of award of the fellowships, scholarships, exhibitions, medals and prizes;
1150775 ethe conditions and mode of appointment and duties of examining bodies, examiners and moderators;
706499 fthe conduct of examinations;
284155 gthe maintenance of discipline among the students of the Institute; and
388266 hany other matter which by this Act or the Statutes is to be or may be provided for by the Ordinances.
789958 29 Ordinances how made.
1912710 1Save as otherwise provided in this section, Ordinances shall be made by the Senate.
1530001 2All Ordinances made by the Senate shall have effect from such date as it may direct, but every Ordinance so made shall be submitted, as soon as may be, to the Board and shall be considered by the Board as its next succeeding meeting.
512053 3The Board shall have power by resolution to modify or cancel any such Ordinance and such Ordinance shall from the date of such resolution stand modified accordingly or cancelled, as the case may be.
560639 30 Tribunal of Arbitration.
1514170 1Any dispute arising out of a contract between an Institute and any of its employees shall, at the request of the employee concerned or at the instance of the Institute, be referred to a Tribunal of Arbitration consisting of one member appointed by the Institute, one member nominated by the employee, and an umpire appointed by the Visitor.
1011262 2The decision of the Tribunal shall be final and shall not be questioned in any court.
1597504 3No suit or proceeding shall lie in any court in respect of any matter which is required by sub- section (1) to be referred to the Tribunal of Arbitration.
161
1689791 4Tribunal of Arbitration shall have power to regulate its own procedure.
687084 5Nothing in any law for the time being in force relating to arbitration shall apply to arbitrations under this section. CHAP

CHAPTER III
THE COUNCIL
174185 31 Establishment of Council.
1300354 1With effect from such date as the Central Government may, by notification in the Official Gazette, specify in this behalf, there shall be established a central body to be called the Council.
1840784 2The Council shall consist of the following members, namely:-
1706301 athe Minister in charge of technical education in the Central Government, ex officio, as Chairman;
1630577 bthe Chairman of each Institute, ex officio;
1185734 cthe Director of each Institute, ex officio;
921218 dthe Chairman, University Grants Commission, ex officio;
1153699 ethe Director- General, Council of Scientific and Industrial Research, ex officio;
1172315 fthe Chairman of the Council of the Indian Institute of Science, Bangalore, ex officio;
102348 gthe director of the Indian Institute of Science, Bangalore, ex officio;
1168549 hthree persons to be nominated by the Central Government, one to represent the Ministry concerned with technical education, another to represent the Ministry of Finance and the third to represent any other Ministry;
177911 ione person to be nominated by the All- India Council for Technical Education;
911165 jnot less than three, but not more than five, persons to be nominated by the Visitor, who shall be persons having special knowledge or practical experience in respect of education, industry, science or technology;
238417 kthree Members of Parliament, of whom two shall be elected by the House of the People from among its members and one by the Council of States from among its members.
162
910505 3An officer of the Ministry of the Central Government concerned with technical education shall be nominated by that Government to act as the Secretary of the Council.
1888921 32 Term of office of, vacancies among, and allowances payable to, members of Council.
1927335 1Save as otherwise provided in this section, the term of office of a member of the Council shall be three years from the date of his nomination or election, as the case may be.
159801 2The term of office of an ex officio member shall continue so long as he holds the office by virtue of which he is a member.
1117037 3A member of the Council referred to in clause (h) of sub- section (2) of section 31 shall hold office during the pleasure of the Central Government.
1094461 4The term of office of a member elected under clause (k) of sub- section (2) of section 31 shall expire as soon as he ceases to be a member of the House which elected him.
1463267 5The term of officer of a member nominated or elected to fill a casual vacancy shall continue for the remainder of the term of the member in whose place he has been nominated or elected.
1363611 6Notwithstanding anything contained in this section an outgoing member shall, unless the Central Government otherwise directs, continue in office until another person is nominated or elected as a member in his place.
1337612 7The members of the Council shall be paid such travelling and other allowances by the Central Government as may be determined by that Government, but no member shall be entitled to any salary by reason of this sub- section.
670203 33 Functions of Council.
38112 1It shall be the general duty of the Council to co- ordinate the activities of all the Institutes.
1269506 2Without prejudice to the provisions of sub- section (1), the Council shall perform the following functions, namely:-
1610741 ato advise on matters relating to the duration of the courses, the degrees and other academic distinctions to be conferred by the Institutes, admission standards and other academic matters;
1007204 bto lay down policy regarding cadres, methods of recruitment and conditions of service of employees, institution of scholarships and freeships, levying of fees and other matters of common interest;
163
144199 cto examine the development plans of each Institute and to approve such of them as are considered necessary and also to indicate broadly the financial implications of such approved plans;
394460 dto examine the annual budget estimates of each Institute and to recommend to the Central Government the allocation of funds for that purpose;
1816114 eto advise the Visitor, if so required, in respect of any function to be performed by him under this Act; and
564316 fto perform such other functions as are assigned to it by or under this Act.
404032 34 Chairman of Council.
1424575 1The Chairman of the Council shall ordinarily preside at the meetings of the Council.
510787 2It shall be the duty of the Chairman of the Council to ensure that the decisions taken by the Council are implemented.
1800932 3The Chairman shall exercise such other powers and perform such other duties as are assigned to him by this Act.
1400995 35 Power to make rules in respect of matters in this Chapter.
875858 1The Central Government may 1 by notification in the Official Gazette,] make rules to carry out the purposes of this Chapter.
80318 2In particular and without prejudice to the generality of the foregoing power, such rules may provide for all or any of the following matters, namely:-
1572254 athe manner of filling vacancies among the members of the Council;
1368091 bthe disqualifications for being chosen as, and for being, a member of the Council;
776452 cthe circumstances in which, and the authority by which, members may be removed;
1860124 dthe meetings of the Council and the procedure of conducting business thereat;
514080 ethe travelling and other allowances payable to members of the Council; and
1823277 fthe functions of the council and the manner in which such functions may be exercised.
87655 31 Every rule made by the Central Government under this Chapter shall be laid, as soon as may be after it is made, before each House of Parliament, while it is in session, for a total period of thirty days which may be comprised in one session or in two or more successive sessions, and if, before the expiry of the session immediately following the session or the successive sessions aforesaid, both Houses agree in making any modification in the rule or both Houses agree that the rule should not be made, the rule shall thereafter have effect only in such modified form or be of no effect, as the case may be; so, however, that any such modification or annulment shall be without prejudice to the validity of anything previously done under that rule."] 164 1Ins. by Act 4 of 1986, s. 2 and Sch. 566016 gexercise such other powers and perform such other duties as may be conferred or imposed upon it by this Act or the Statutes.
